characters

Class Shape

  • java.lang.Object
    • characters.Shape
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Line

    public abstract class Shape
extends java.lang.Object
    The Shape class represents a double-precision Shape that can be drawn using the Processing library.The Shape class is a superclass for the other 3 classes. This Version doesn't solve for vertical, horizontal, collinear, or parallel lines.
    Version:
    10/5/21
    Author:
    frank_an

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Shape(double x, double y)
      Initializes a Shape with a given start point (x,y).

      • Shape

        public Shape(double x,
             double y)
        Initializes a Shape with a given start point (x,y).
        Parameters:
        x - X-coordinate of start point.
        y - Y-coordinate of start point.

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public abstract void draw(processing.core.PApplet drawer)
        Draws a new instance of a Shape object with the x and y coordinate as its starting point.
        Parameters:
        drawer - The Processing PApplet on which to draw the Shape.
        Precondition:
        drawer must be null, and appropriate settings should have been selected (color, fill, etc.)

      • getArea

        public abstract double getArea()
        Finds the area of the Shape.
        Returns:
        A double that is the area of the Shape.

      • getPerimeter

        public abstract double getPerimeter()
        Finds the perimeter of the Shape.
        Returns:
        A double that is the perimeter of the Shape.

      • intersect

        public abstract boolean intersect(Shape other)
        Tests whether this Shape intersects with the other Shape object.
        Parameters:
        other - The other Rectangle to test intersection.
        Returns:
        True if the shape intersects with another Shape, false if it doesn't.

      • isPointInside

        public abstract boolean isPointInside(double x,
                                      double y)
        Tests whether a point(x,y) is inside the Shape object.
        Parameters:
        x - The x coordinate of the testing point.
        y - The y coordinate of the testing point.
        Returns:
        True if the point is inside the Shape, false if it isn't inside the Shape.

      • getCenterX

        public abstract double getCenterX()
        Returns the x coordinate of the center of the Shape.
        Returns:
        A double that is the X-coordinate of the Shape's center.

      • getCenterY

        public abstract double getCenterY()
        Returns the y coordinate of the center of the Shape.
        Returns:
        A double that is the Y-coordinate of the Shape's center.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a String containing debugging info for the Shape (the values of fields)
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A String that prints out the fields, the x and y coordinate of the starting point and the Shape Fill and Stroke Color, to make debugging Shape easier.
